addressleaf.section:
De Mons
r
Bodley a mons
r
le Comte d'Essex le 22
me
de fevrier
1594

page.lettertext:
fol.104r
Maie it please y
r
good Lp besides
t
w
ch
I have
written to my
L. T
re
r
whereof I send the copie
to y
r
Lp. herewith I have litle other matter to
signifie presentlie.
Coronell Murrey
of whom I
written in my last of the 14 though
he beare
the affection
of a dutifull subject to the
K. of Scott
& doth
relie very much upon his favour unto him, yet he
makes it a very cleare case,
t
if this succour
of mony w
ch
Coronell Stuart doth require shall
be drawen from the states, it wilbe wholly
devided among some about the K. being such as
tly neede it, &
tly (as the
chauncellor
)
t
have sent unto the K: And therefore as a
practise by abusing the K: to make their private
bennefitt, he would not willingly have it speede
still he doth
sist in his former affection and
affirmeth upon knowledge
t
the K; hath no neede
of any suche aide, as the states are made beleeve
For where it so
t
it were his desire or
t
it had
ben heertofore, to suppresse those Earles of his
contrey, they had either ben taken, or slaine, or chased
out of
scotland
a great while agoe. But what
cause he alledgeth, why it is not effective, I shewed
y
r
L in my last. It were to long to holde
y
r
L. with rehearsall of discourses w
ch
I have
had with diverse
sones, and with
Barnevelt
in speciall, about the scottishe demaundes.
but thoughe I finde them very forward to grati-
fie the K. yet I hope I have obtained by way of
good
swasions, & intimation of some perills,
t
they will neither take his
te in any daunger-
ous practise, nor second him otherwise
in any action at all, if it be important, until
they notifie the same to her Ma
tie
before.
And
thus I humbly take my leave from the Hage.
Fe
b
22 1594.
Y
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley.
